Class soc.client.BoardPanel extends java.awt.Canvas implements Serializable

serialVersionUID: 2668610842427948581L

Serialized Fields

minSize

java.awt.Dimension minSize
Minimum required width and height, as determined by options and BoardPanel.isRotated. Used by BoardPanel.getMinimumSize().

Since:
1.1.08

hasCalledSetSize

boolean hasCalledSetSize
Ensure that super.setSize is called at least once.

Since:
1.1.08

is6player

boolean is6player
The board is configured for 6-player mode (and is BoardPanel.isRotated); set in constructor by checking Board.getBoardEncodingFormat(). The entire coordinate system is land, except the rightmost hexes are unused (7D-DD-D7 row). The 6-player mode uses BoardPanel.hexX_6pl instead of BoardPanel.hexX_st for coordinates.

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
BoardPanel.inactiveHexNums

isRotated

boolean isRotated
The board is visually rotated 90 degrees clockwise (6-player: game opt PL > 4) compared to the internal coordinates.

Use this for rotation:

  • From internal to screen (cw): P'=(BoardPanel.panelMinBH-y, x)
  • From screen to internal (ccw): P'=(y, BoardPanel.panelMinBW-x)
When the board is also scaled, go in this order: Rotate clockwise, then scale up; Scale down, then rotate counterclockwise.

When calculating position at which to draw an image or polygon, remember that rotation changes which corner is considered (0,0), and the image is offset from that corner. (For example, BoardPanel.drawHex(Graphics, int) subtracts HEXHEIGHT from x, after rotation but before scaling.)

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
BoardPanel.isScaledOrRotated

isScaledOrRotated

boolean isScaledOrRotated
Convenience flag - The board is rotated and/or scaled up. Check both of those flags when transforming between screen coordinates and internal coordinates. Go in this order: Rotate clockwise, then scale up; Scale down, then rotate counterclockwise.

Since:
1.1.08

scaledPanelX

int scaledPanelX
actual size on-screen, not internal-pixels size (BoardPanel.panelMinBW, BoardPanel.panelMinBH)

scaledPanelY

int scaledPanelY
actual size on-screen, not internal-pixels size (BoardPanel.panelMinBW, BoardPanel.panelMinBH)

panelMinBW

int panelMinBW
Minimum width and height, in board-internal coordinates. Differs from static BoardPanel.PANELX, BoardPanel.PANELY for 6-player board. Differs from BoardPanel.minSize because minSize takes BoardPanel.isRotated into account, so minSize isn't suitable for use in rescaling formulas.

Since:
1.1.08

panelMinBH

int panelMinBH
Minimum width and height, in board-internal coordinates. Differs from static BoardPanel.PANELX, BoardPanel.PANELY for 6-player board. Differs from BoardPanel.minSize because minSize takes BoardPanel.isRotated into account, so minSize isn't suitable for use in rescaling formulas.

Since:
1.1.08

isScaled

boolean isScaled
The board is currently scaled larger than BoardPanel.panelMinBW x BoardPanel.panelMinBH pixels. Use BoardPanel.scaleToActualX(int), BoardPanel.scaleFromActualX(int), etc to convert between internal and actual screen pixel coordinates.

When the board is also rotated, go in this order: Rotate clockwise, then scale up; Scale down, then rotate counterclockwise.

See Also:
BoardPanel.isScaledOrRotated

scaledAt

long scaledAt
Time of last resize, as returned by System.currentTimeMillis(). Used with BoardPanel.scaledMissedImage.

scaledMissedImage

boolean scaledMissedImage
Flag used while drawing a scaled board. If board size was recently changed, could be waiting for an image to resize. If it still hasn't appeared after 7 seconds, we'll give up and create a new one. (This can happen due to AWT bugs.) Set in BoardPanel.drawHex(Graphics, int), checked in BoardPanel.drawBoard(Graphics).

See Also:
BoardPanel.scaledHexFail

drawnEmptyAt

long drawnEmptyAt
Time of start of board repaint, as returned by System.currentTimeMillis(). Used in BoardPanel.drawBoardEmpty(Graphics) with BoardPanel.scaledMissedImage.

Since:
1.1.08

diceNumberCircleFont

java.awt.Font diceNumberCircleFont
Font of dice-number circles appearing on hexes.

Since:
1.1.08

diceNumberCircleFM

java.awt.FontMetrics diceNumberCircleFM
FontMetrics of BoardPanel.diceNumberCircleFont.

Since:
1.1.08

hexIDtoNum

int[] hexIDtoNum
translate hex ID to number to get coords

inactiveHexNums

boolean[] inactiveHexNums
Hex numbers which aren't drawn, or null. For 6-player board, the rightmost line of hexes (7D-DD-D7) are skipped. Indicate this to BoardPanel.drawBoard(Graphics).

Since:
1.1.08

hexX

int[] hexX
hex coordinates for drawing pieces on the board. Points to BoardPanel.hexX_st or BoardPanel.hexX_6pl, and BoardPanel.hexY_st or BoardPanel.hexY_6pl, depending on BoardPanel.is6player flag.

Since:
1.1.08

hexY

int[] hexY
hex coordinates for drawing pieces on the board. Points to BoardPanel.hexX_st or BoardPanel.hexX_6pl, and BoardPanel.hexY_st or BoardPanel.hexY_6pl, depending on BoardPanel.is6player flag.

Since:
1.1.08

scaledHexes

scaledPorts

buildReqTimerTask

soc.client.BoardPanel.BoardPanelSendBuildTask buildReqTimerTask
For right-click build menu; used for fallback part of client-server-client communication of a build request. Created whenever right-click build request sent. This is the fallback for the normal method: 
  BoardPanel.popupExpectingBuildRequest
  PlayerInterface.updateAtGameState
  BoardPanel.popupFireBuildingRequest

hilight

int hilight
Edge or node being pointed to. When placing a road/settlement/city, used for coordinate of "ghost" piece under the mouse pointer. 0 when nothing is hilighted. -1 for a road at edge 0x00.

edgeMap

int[] edgeMap
Map grid sectors (from unscaled on-screen coordinates) to hex edges. The grid has 15 columns and 23 rows. This maps graphical coordinates to the board coordinate system.

Note: For the 6-player board, edge 0x00 is a valid edge that can be built on. It is marked here as -1, since a value of 0 marks an invalid edge in this map.

The edge number at grid (x,y) is in edgeMap[x + (y * 15)].

In 6-player mode, there is an extra ring of water/port hexes on the outside, which isn't within the coordinate system. So this grid is shifted +1 column, +3 rows.

See Also:
BoardPanel.findEdge(int, int), BoardPanel.initEdgeMapAux(int, int, int, int, int)

nodeMap

int[] nodeMap
Map grid sectors (from unscaled on-screen coordinates) to hex nodes. The grid has 15 columns and 23 rows. This maps graphical coordinates to the board coordinate system. Each row of hexes touches 3 columns and 5 rows here. For instance, hex 0x35 has its top-center point (node) in row y=6, and its bottom-center point in row y=10, of this grid. Its left edge is column x=3, and right is column x=5.

The node number at grid (x,y) is nodeMap[x + (y * 15)].

In 6-player mode, there is an extra ring of water/port hexes on the outside, which isn't within the coordinate system. So this grid is shifted +1 column, +3 rows.

See Also:
BoardPanel.findNode(int, int), BoardPanel.initNodeMapAux(int, int, int, int, int)

hexMap

int[] hexMap
Map grid sectors (from on-screen coordinates) to hexes.

See Also:
BoardPanel.findHex(int, int)

game

Game game
The game which this board is a part of

board

Board board
The board in the game

player

Player player
The player that is using this interface

playerNumber

int playerNumber
player number if in a game, or -1.

otherPlayer

Player otherPlayer
When in "consider" mode, this is the player we're talking to

buffer

java.awt.Image buffer
offscreen buffer of everything (board, pieces, hovering pieces, tooltip), to prevent flicker.

See Also:
BoardPanel.emptyBoardBuffer

emptyBoardBuffer

java.awt.Image emptyBoardBuffer
offscreen buffer of board without any pieces placed, to prevent flicker. If the board layout changes (at start of game, for example), call BoardPanel.flushBoardLayoutAndRepaint() to clear the buffered copy.

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:

int mode
Modes of interaction; for correlation to game state, see BoardPanel.updateMode(). For tooltip's mode, see BoardPanel.BoardToolTip.hoverMode.

This holds the coord of the last stlmt placed in the initial phase.

playerInterface

PlayerInterface playerInterface
the player interface that this board is a part of

robberGhostFill

java.awt.Color[] robberGhostFill
Cached colors, for use for robber's "ghost" (previous position) when moving the robber. Values are determined the first time the robber is ghosted on that type of tile. Index ranges from 0 to Board.MAX_ROBBER_HEX.

See Also:

sitButIsLock

boolean sitButIsLock
When true, the game is still forming, player has chosen a seat; "Sit Here" button is labeled as "Lock". Humans can use this to lock robots out of that seat, so as to start a game with fewer players and some vacant seats. Set by HandPanel.renameSitButLock(), cleared elsewhere. This affects HandPanel.sitBut and not HandPanel.sittingRobotLockBut.

offer

TradeOfferPanel offer
Display other players' trade offers and related messages. Does not apply to client's hand panel (playerIsClient == true). Both offer and counter-offer display are part of this object. Also used to display board-reset vote messages. When displaying a message, looks like a SpeechBalloon.

If the handpanel is not tall enough, other controls will be obscured by this one. This low height is indicated by HandPanel.offerHidesControls and possibly HandPanel.offerCounterHidesFace.

See Also:
HandPanel.offerIsResetMessage, HandPanel.offerIsDiscardMessage

serverGames

GameList serverGames
all announced game names on the remote server, including games which we can't join due to limitations of the client. May also contain options for all announced games on the server (not just ones we're in) which we can join (version is not higher than our version).

Key is the game name, without the UNJOINABLE prefix. This field is null until handleGAMES, handleGAMESWITHOPTIONS, handleNEWGAME or handleNEWGAMEWITHOPTIONS is called.

Since:
1.1.07

gamesUnjoinableOverride

java.util.Hashtable<K,V> gamesUnjoinableOverride
the unjoinable game names from PlayerClient.serverGames that player has asked to join, and been told they can't. If they click again, try to connect. (This is a failsafe against bugs in server or client version-recognition.) Both key and value are the game name, without the UNJOINABLE prefix.

practiceServer

SOCServer practiceServer
for local-practice game via PlayerClient.prCli; not connected to the network, not suited for multi-player games. Use PlayerClient.localTCPServer for those. SOCMessages of games where Game.isLocal is true are sent to practiceServer.

Null before it's started in PlayerClient.startPracticeGame().

for connection to local-practice server PlayerClient.practiceServer. Null before it's started in PlayerClient.startPracticeGame().

int numPracticeGames
Number of practice games started; used for naming practice games

localTCPServer

SOCServer localTCPServer
Client-hosted TCP server. If client is running this server, it's also connected as a client, instead of being client of a remote server. Started via PlayerClient.startLocalTCPServer(int). PlayerClient.practiceServer may still be activated at the user's request. Note that Game.isLocal is false for localTCPServer's games.

sbFixNeeded

boolean sbFixNeeded
In 6-player games, text areas temporarily zoom when the mouse is over them. On windows, the scrollbars aren't considered part of the text areas, so we get a mouseExited when user is trying to scroll the text area. Workaround: Instead of looking for mouseExited, look for mouseEntered on handpanels or boardpanel.

textDisplayRollExpected

int textDisplayRollExpected
To reduce text clutter: server has just sent a dice result message. If the next text message from server is the roll, replace: * It's Player's turn to roll the dice. \n * Player rolled a 4 and a 5. with: * It's Player's turn to roll. Rolled a 9.

Set to 0 at most times. Set to the roll result when roll text is expected. Will be cleared to 0 in PlayerInterface.print(String). Whenever this field is nonzero, textmessages from the server will be scanned for " rolled a ".

Package soc.game

Class soc.game.Board extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

serialVersionUID: 4905733106998982392L

Serialized Fields

boardWidth

int boardWidth
Size of board in coordinates (not in number of hexes across). Default size per BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL is: 
   Hexes: 11 to DD
   Nodes: 01 or 10, to FE or EF
   Edges: 00 to EE

Since:
1.1.06

boardHeight

int boardHeight
Size of board in coordinates (not in number of hexes across). Default size per BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL is: 
   Hexes: 11 to DD
   Nodes: 01 or 10, to FE or EF
   Edges: 00 to EE

Since:
1.1.06

minNode

int minNode
Minimum and maximum edge and node coordinates in this board's encoding. (Board.MAXNODE is the same in both current encodings.)

Since:
1.1.08

minEdge

int minEdge
Minimum and maximum edge and node coordinates in this board's encoding. (Board.MAXNODE is the same in both current encodings.)

Since:
1.1.08

maxEdge

int maxEdge
Minimum and maximum edge and node coordinates in this board's encoding. (Board.MAXNODE is the same in both current encodings.)

Since:
1.1.08

boardEncodingFormat

int boardEncodingFormat
The encoding format of board coordinates, or Board.BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL (default, original). The board size determines the required encoding format.
  • 1 - Original format: hexadecimal 0x00 to 0xFF. Coordinate range is 0 to 15 (in decimal). Port types and facings encoded within Board.hexLayout.
  • 2 - 6-player board, variant of original format: hexadecimal 0x00 to 0xFF. Coordinate range is 0 to 15 (in decimal). Port types stored in Board.portsLayout. Added in 1.1.08.

Since:
1.1.06

hexLayout

int[] hexLayout
Hex data array, one element per water or land (or port, which is special water) hex. Each element's coordinates on the board ("hex ID") is Board.numToHexID[i]. Each element's value encodes hex type and, if a port, its facing (Board.FACING_NE to Board.FACING_NW).

Key to the hexLayout[] values: 

       0 : desert  Board.DESERT_HEX
       1 : clay    Board.CLAY_HEX
       2 : ore     Board.ORE_HEX
       3 : sheep   Board.SHEEP_HEX
       4 : wheat   Board.WHEAT_HEX
       5 : wood    Board.WOOD_HEX also: Board.MAX_LAND_HEX Board.MAX_ROBBER_HEX
       6 : water   Board.WATER_HEX
       7 : misc port ("3:1") facing land in direction 1 (NorthEast)
                             (this port type is Board.MISC_PORT in Board.getPortTypeFromNodeCoord(int))
       8 : misc port facing 2 (Board.FACING_E)
       9 : misc port facing 3 (Board.FACING_SE)
       10 : misc port facing 4 (Board.FACING_SW)
       11 : misc port facing 5 (Board.FACING_W)
       12 : misc port facing 6 (NorthWest)
       16+: non-misc ("2:1") encoded port
Non-misc ports are encoded here in binary like this:
      (port facing, 1-6)        (kind of port)
              \--> [0 0 0][0 0 0 0] <--/
Kind of port:
        1 : clay  (port type Board.CLAY_PORT in Board.getPortTypeFromNodeCoord(int))
        2 : ore    Board.ORE_PORT
        3 : sheep  Board.SHEEP_PORT
        4 : wheat  Board.WHEAT_PORT
        5 : wood   Board.WOOD_PORT
Port facing is the edge of the port's hex touching land, which contains 2 nodes where player can build a port settlement/city; facing is a number 1-6 (Board.FACING_NE-Board.FACING_NW). 
      6 <--.    .--> 1
            \/\/
            /  \
       5<--|    |--> 2
           |    |
            \  /
            /\/\
      4 <--.    .--> 3

See Also:
Board.getHexTypeFromNumber(int), Board.getAdjacentNodeToHex(int, int)

portsLayout

int[] portsLayout
On the 6-player (v2 layout) board, each port's type. Null otherwise. Same value range as in Board.hexLayout. (In the standard (v1) board, these are part of Board.hexLayout instead.) 1 element per port. Same ordering as Board.PORTS_FACING_V2. Initialized in Board.makeNewBoard(Hashtable).

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
Board.ports

numberLayout

int[] numberLayout
Dice number from hex numbers. For coord mapping, see Board.numToHexID

numToHexID

int[] numToHexID
Hex coordinates ("IDs") of each hex number ("hex number" means index within Board.hexLayout).
  • Board.BOARD_ENCODING_ORIGINAL: The hexes in here are the board's land hexes and also the surrounding ring of water/port hexes.
  • Board.BOARD_ENCODING_6PLAYER: The hexes in here are the board's land hexes and also the unused hexes (rightmost column: 7D - DD - D7).

See Also:
Board.hexIDtoNum, Board.nodesOnBoard

hexIDtoNum

int[] hexIDtoNum
translate hex ID (hex coordinate) to an array index within Board.hexLayout, which is sometimes called its "hex number". The numbers in here are the board's land hexes and also the surrounding ring of water/port hexes. Initialized in constructor. Length is >= Board.MAXHEX. A value of -1 means the ID isn't a valid hex number on the board.

See Also:
Board.numToHexID, Board.nodeIDtoPortType

nodeIDtoPortType

int[] nodeIDtoPortType
translate node ID (node coordinate) to a port's type (Board.MISC_PORT to Board.WOOD_PORT). Initialized in Board.makeNewBoard(Hashtable). Length is >= Board.MAXNODE. A value of -1 means the ID isn't a valid port on the board.

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
Board.ports, Board.portsLayout, Board.hexIDtoNum

HEXNODES

int[] HEXNODES
Offset to add to hex coordinate to get all adjacent node coords, starting at index 0 at the top (northern point of hex) and going clockwise (RST dissertation figure A.5). Because we're looking at nodes and not edges (points, not sides, of the hex), these are offset from the set of "facing" directions by 30 degrees. -- see getAdjacent* methods instead

robberHex

int robberHex
the hex coordinate that the robber is in; placed on desert in constructor

ports

java.util.Vector<E>[] ports
where the ports are; coordinates per port type. Indexes are port types, Board.MISC_PORT to Board.WOOD_PORT.

See Also:
Board.portsLayout

pieces

java.util.Vector<E> pieces
pieces on the board; Vector of PlayingPiece

roads

java.util.Vector<E> roads
roads on the board; Vector of PlayingPiece

settlements

java.util.Vector<E> settlements
settlements on the board; Vector of PlayingPiece

cities

java.util.Vector<E> cities
cities on the board; Vector of PlayingPiece

rand

java.util.Random rand
random number generator

nodesOnBoard

java.util.Hashtable<K,V> nodesOnBoard
a list of nodes on the land of the board; key is node's Integer coordinate, value is Boolean. nodes on outer edges of surrounding water/ports are not on the board. See dissertation figure A.2. See also Player.initLegalAndPotentialSettlements().

Class soc.game.Game extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

isLocal

boolean isLocal
true if the game's network is local for practice. Used by client to route messages to appropriate connection. NOT CURRENTLY SET AT SERVER. Instead check if server's strSocketName != null, or if connection instanceof LocalStringConnection.

Since 1.1.09: This flag is set at the server, only if the server is a local practice server whose stringport name is SOCServer.PRACTICE_STRINGPORT.

hasOldClients

clientVersionLowest

clientVersionHighest

For use at server; lowest and highest version of connected clients.

clientVersionMinRequired

int clientVersionMinRequired
For use at server; lowest version of client which can connect to this game (based on game options/features added in a given version), or -1 if unknown. Calculated by GameOption.optionsMinimumVersion(Hashtable). Format is the internal integer format, see Version.versionNumber(). Value may sometimes be too low at client, see Game.getClientVersionMinRequired() for details.

isFromBoardReset

boolean isFromBoardReset
true if the game came from a board reset

boardResetVoteRequester

int boardResetVoteRequester
If a board reset vote is active, player number who requested the vote. All human players must vote unanimously, or board reset is rejected. -1 if no vote is active. Synchronize on Game.boardResetVotes before reading or writing.

boardResetVotes

int[] boardResetVotes
If a board reset vote is active, votes are recorded here. Values: Game.VOTE_NONE, Game.VOTE_YES, Game.VOTE_NO. Indexed 0 to Game.MAXPLAYERS-1. Synchronize on this object before reading or writing.

boardResetVotesWaiting

int boardResetVotesWaiting
If a board reset vote is active, we're waiting to receive this many more votes. All human players vote, except the vote requester. Robots do not vote. Synchronize on Game.boardResetVotes before reading or writing. When the vote is complete, or before the first vote has begun, this is 0. Set in resetVoteBegin, resetVoteRegister. Cleared in resetVoteClear.

board

Board board
the game board

opts

java.util.Hashtable<K,V> opts
the game options (GameOption), or null

Since:
1.1.07

players

Player[] players
the players; never contains a null element, use Game.isSeatVacant(int) to see if a position is occupied.

seats

int[] seats
the states for the player's seats

seatLocks

boolean[] seatLocks
the states if the locks for the player's seats

currentPlayerNumber

int currentPlayerNumber
the number of the current player

firstPlayerNumber

int firstPlayerNumber
the first player to place a settlement

lastPlayerNumber

int lastPlayerNumber
the last player to place the first settlement

maxPlayers

int maxPlayers
maxPlayers is 4 for the standard game, or 6 if this game is on the 6-player board, with corresponding rules.

Since:
1.1.08

currentDice

int currentDice
the current dice result. -1 at start of game, 0 during player's turn before roll (state Game.PLAY).

gameState

int gameState
the current game state

oldGameState

int oldGameState
the old game state

placingRobberForKnightCard

boolean placingRobberForKnightCard
If true, and if state is Game.PLACING_ROBBER, the robber is being moved because a knight card has just been played. Thus, if Game.forceEndTurn() is called, the knight card should then be returned to the player's hand.

forcingEndTurn

boolean forcingEndTurn
If true, this turn is being ended. Controller of game (server) should call Game.endTurn() whenever possible. Usually set when we have called Game.forceEndTurn(), and forced the current player to discard randomly, and are waiting for other players to discard in gamestate Game.WAITING_FOR_DISCARDS. Once all players have discarded, the turn should be ended.

See Also:
Game.forceEndTurn()

askedSpecialBuildPhase

boolean askedSpecialBuildPhase
If true, it's a 6-player board and at least one player has requested to build during the Special Building Phase that occurs between turns.

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
Game.specialBuildPhase_afterPlayerNumber

specialBuildPhase_afterPlayerNumber

int specialBuildPhase_afterPlayerNumber
For the 6-player board's Special Building Phase, the player number whose normal turn (roll, place, etc) has just ended. Game state is Game.SPECIAL_BUILDING. The Special Building Phase changes Game.currentPlayerNumber. So, it begins by calling Game.advanceTurn() to the next player, and continues clockwise until Game.currentPlayerNumber == Game.specialBuildPhase_afterPlayerNumber. At that point, the Special Building Phase is over, and it's the next player's turn as usual.

Since:
1.1.08
See Also:
Game.askedSpecialBuildPhase

playerWithLargestArmy

int playerWithLargestArmy
the player with the largest army, or -1 if none

oldPlayerWithLargestArmy

int oldPlayerWithLargestArmy
To remember last Game.playerWithLargestArmy during Game.saveLargestArmyState() / Game.restoreLargestArmyState().

playerWithLongestRoad

int playerWithLongestRoad
the player with the longest road, or -1 if none

oldPlayerWithLongestRoad

java.util.Stack<E> oldPlayerWithLongestRoad
used to restore the LR player

playerWithWin

int playerWithWin
the player declared winner, if gamestate == OVER; otherwise -1

numDevCards

int numDevCards
the number of development cards left

devCardDeck

int[] devCardDeck
the development card deck

rand

java.util.Random rand
used to generate random numbers

allOriginalPlayers

boolean allOriginalPlayers
used to track if there were any player subs

startTime

java.util.Date startTime
when this game was created

expiration

long expiration
expiration time for this game in milliseconds

turnCount

int turnCount
The number of normal turns (not rounds, not initial placements), including this turn. This is 0 during initial piece placement, and 1 when the first player is about to roll dice for the first time. updated in Game.updateAtTurn().

Since:
1.1.07

roundCount

int roundCount
The number of normal rounds (each player has 1 turn per round, after initial placements), including this round. for gameoption N7: Roll no 7s during first # rounds. This is 0 during initial piece placement, and 1 when the first player is about to roll dice for the first time. It becomes 2 when that first player's turn begins again. updated in Game.updateAtTurn().

Since:
1.1.07

potentialRoads

potentialSettlements

boolean[] potentialSettlements
a list of nodes where a settlement could be placed on the next turn. At start of the game, all Player.legalSettlements are also potential. When the second settlement is placed, this is cleared, and then re-set via updatePotentials(Road).

See Also:
Player.legalSettlements, Board.nodesOnBoard

potentialCities

boolean[] potentialCities
a list of nodes where a city could be placed on the next turn.

ports

boolean[] ports
a boolean array stating wheather this player is touching a particular kind of port. Index == port type, in range Board.MISC_PORT to Board.WOOD_PORT

currentOffer

this is the current trade offer that this player is making

playedDevCard

boolean playedDevCard
this is true if the player played a development card this turn

robotFlag

this is true if this player is a robot

java.util.Vector<E> unnamedConns
the newly connected, unnamed connections. Adding/removing/naming/versioning of connections synchronizes on this Vector.

java.util.Vector<E> inQueue
clients in process of connecting

cliVersionsConnected

java.util.TreeMap<K,V> cliVersionsConnected
Versions of currently connected clients, according to StringConnection.getVersion(). Key = Integer(version). Value = ConnVersionCounter. Synchronized on Server.unnamedConns, like many other client-related structures.

Since:
1.1.06
See Also:
Server.clientVersionAdd(int), Server.clientVersionRem(int)

Since:
1.1.06

Server.cliVersionsConnected

int cliVersionMax
Minimum and maximum client version currently connected. Meaningless if Server.numberOfConnections is 0.

Since:
1.1.06
See Also:
Server.cliVersionsConnected

cliVersionsConnectedQuickCheckCount

int cliVersionsConnectedQuickCheckCount
For Server.cliVersionsConnected, the count of "quick" consistency-checks since the last full check.

Since:
1.1.06

utilTimer

java.util.Timer utilTimer
Timer for scheduling timed/recurring tasks.

Since:
1.1.06

cliConnDisconPrintsPending

java.util.HashMap<K,V> cliConnDisconPrintsPending
Client disconnect error messages, to be printed after a short delay. If the client reconnects during the delay, the disconnect and reconnect messages are not printed. This is only used if D.ebugIsEnabled() is true.

Keys: The StringConnection object is used as the key within Server.addConnection(StringConnection). The connection keyname is used as the key within Server.removeConnection(StringConnection); if this is null, the message is printed immediately, and not added to this map.

Since:
1.1.07
See Also:
#CLI_CONN_DISCON_PRINT_TIMER_FIRE_MS
